data.title: Great introduction to Ashville
data.text: CJ knew the city well had a good sense of its history. Personable fellow with great recommendations for what to do over the next couple of days

data.title: A private tour with CJ
data.text: CJ is an excellent tour guide. Four of us scheduled a private tour with him. He is punctual, knowledgeable and very professional. He has a dry wit and sense of humor that added extra local flavor to the tour. We covered a lot of ground and learned a great deal in 75 minutes. I had been to Asheville many times over a number of years and yet I learned a great deal I didn't know. I recommend CJ and this tour highly, especially to first-time visitors who only have 2-3 days to visit Asheville.

data.title: A must for your first day
data.text: We took this tour the first day and am so glad we did. It was worth every penny as the tour guide knows this city inside and out. He even took us up to the top of the BB&T building so we could get a birds-eye view of Asheville, I don't think any other tours get to do that. If you even remotely are interested in the food scene and some background of Asheville, this is the first tour to take.

data.title: Great start to our visit!
data.text: We really enjoyed our time on our tour. We did the private version and paid for the tour, but it was definitely worth it. We had been to the Biltmore house before but had never really explored the downtown. The overview of the restaurants was so good, we didn't know which one to try at the end of the tour. The guide was very personable and he definitely has done his research. He mentioned something about discounts for future hotel stays, and I think we might take him up on that.

data.title: What a guide!
data.text: So my wife and I were just in Asheville visiting from Berlin, Germany. We have been on these big walking tours in Europe before and didnt know what to expect in such a "small" American town. But I would recommend this to anyone coming to Asheville for the first time. Its a great way to get an overview of the city, along with some local attractions and insider tips.  I think like me CJ is a foodie which is great because he points out the best spots in town for good food. It is an easy walk, insightful, fun, and FREE! Need I say more. This should be the first stop in Asheville, CJ will point you in the right direction.

data.title: CJ Good Guide
data.text: We saw an ad for this on a bulletin board so we went to Vance Square to try it out. CJ is very personable and knowledgeable.  We were the only ones who showed up so we had a private tour.  It isn't an in-depth tour but a good overview with good suggestions for eating places and places to get locally crafted art and other products.  There are discounts associated with the tour but by the time we were through, we had forgotten which ones they were!  Otherwise, we enjoyed the tour and it was certainly worth the money!!

data.title: Great introduction to Asheville
data.text: I live in Asheville, but I love learning more about the city and discovering new places. This tour is a great first stop for visitors as it gives a good overview of downtown and local attractions. It is an easy walk and covers the important people and places of Asheville, currently and some history. CJ points out multiple good places to eat and fun things to do, like the drum circle, Biltmore House, ziplining, and just hanging out downtown having a beer. The tour is only an hour, and is free! I certainly learned some new places to go and discovered some new things I never knew about Asheville. http://ashevillehistoricinns.wordpress.com/2013/08/29/asheville-free-walking-tour/

data.title: Excellent tour
data.text:
We have been in Asheville many times but this time we decided to go on the free walking tour.  I wish we did this many years ago.  We really never went through town we were always on the out skirts.  Learned a lot and found new places to eat.  
Also the history of Asheville is very interesting.  Loved the tour.

data.title: Great Start to Your Visit!
data.text: I went to Asheville July 10-16, 2013 to visit my son, who is doing an internship there this summer.  While my son was at work, I decided to visit the city and do some sightseeing.   The first thing I decided to do was take the free walking tour. Free is good, right?   What a great way to get acquainted with the city, especially all the local eating and shopping establishments.  CJ of Wilcox Travel, walked us down a few of the main streets in town and pointed out some interesting historical facts about the city.  However, the tour mostly focused on the local culinary scene, which is extensive in Asheville!  I went to a few of the places CJ pointed out, and they were all great.  I even got a discount when I mentioned that I had taken the tour.  One nice thing about Asheville is that most of the restaurants and shops in the downtown area are locally owned, so you will get a unique dining and shopping experience.  I highly recommend that you make the free walking tour your first stop during your visit to Asheville.

data.title: good walking tour
data.text: I live in Asheville, NC which is the site of this walking tour. I went to improve my knowledge of the downtown area. CJ Jones, the tour guide, did an excellent job of summarizing the hot spots within walking distance of the starting point. He provided a bit of local history, color and suggestions for dining, attractions and entertainment. I would recommend the tour.
